private_information: I start the day in Bayview and can travel between neighborhoods
My goal is to meet as many friends as possible today
I prefer contiguous meeting blocks and reasonable transit times
visitor.goal: Maximize meetings with friends today while ensuring a meeting with John of at least 75 minutes within his availability window

private_information: I will be at Russian Hill from 17:30 to 21:00
I am willing to meet during my availability window for up to the full window
john.goal: Meet the visitor for at least 75 minutes during my availability window at Russian Hill

orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver that schedules meetings and travel to meet the goals and constraints of the agents

public_information: Locations in the city include Bayview and Russian Hill
Travel time from Bayview to Russian Hill is 23 minutes
Travel time from Russian Hill to Bayview is 23 minutes
John is at Russian Hill from 17:30 to 21:00
Meeting with John should be at least 75 minutes

context.system_prompt: You are a traveler visiting San Francisco for the day. Provide a concise description of your available time windows, location constraints, travel capabilities, and meeting preferences. Do not output PDDL.
context.prompt: Your name is visitor. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->visitor->private_information} to produce structured availability, preferred meeting durations, and any constraints relevant to scheduling meetings. Output should be clear and machine friendly.

context.system_prompt: You are a local friend who will be available at a specified location for a time window. Provide your availability and any meeting constraints. Do not output PDDL.
context.prompt: Your name is john. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->john->private_information} to state your availability window, preferred meeting durations, and any constraints. Output should be clear and machine friendly.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling and PDDL modeling. Your task is to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions for distinct agents clearly separated and preserve agent-specific constraints. Model travel durations, time windows, meeting durations, and an objective to maximize meetings while ensuring required minimum meeting durations.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the structured availability and constraints from the agents: {info_visitor} and {info_john}. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} to model locations, travel times, agent start time, and John's availability window. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes: locations Bayview and Russian Hill, travel durative actions with specified durations, meeting actions reserved per agent, a constraint that the visitor arrives in Bayview at 09:00, John's availability from 17:30 to 21:00 at Russian Hill, and a constraint that the meeting with John is at least 75 minutes. Include an optimization objective appropriate for FastDownwards, such as minimizing makespan or maximizing a numeric score representing number of meetings. Enclose domain and problem as required.
